content.body: "This collection of indepedent individuals not acting with any common agenda"

wow, I can't believe I just read a message from Rob in which he agreed with Hixie quite a few times, and actually made some reasonable arguments where he didn't in some cases. http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2009Jan/0675.html
Dashiva: my problem is not the wording, it's the implication that there is any specific collection of people who have common characteristics of being uncooperative
which i don't think is true, and which i particular don't think is productive
it seems to be common for people to forget about the HTML4 diff document we already have
tbh I have trouble keeping track of the different documents and mailing lists and I pay fairly good attention
Lachy: Probably because it's not normative and therefore nobody even remembers it exists
yeah, possibly. Anyway, I just mentioned it on the list to remind people
Hey, I started redesiging the element summary boxes for use in the authoring guide. http://lachy.id.au/temp/template.html
let me know what you think, and any suggestions for improvement
note that the relevant items will be links once included in the main document and the spec gen does it for me
I'm going to bed now, leave feedback if you've got it
for some reason that page brings to mind a few years ago when Hixie was trying to make the mozilla mycroft search plugins page look nice
tries to work out what type of object Window.window should return in the idl
I updated the element summary template. http://lachy.id.au/temp/template.html
